segments.en: Hello everyone, and welcome back to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎回到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: And my name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we're going to be visiting one of my favorite places, I must say.
segments.cn: 今天我们要去我最喜欢的地方之一。

segments.en: Really, so you're a big meat eater.
segments.cn: 真的，你是个大肉食者。

segments.en: I am.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: I have to have meat every day, so that's why I usually go to the butcher.
segments.cn: 我每天都要吃肉，所以我通常去肉店。

segments.en: Alright, so vegetarians be warned.
segments.cn: 好吧，素食者请注意。

segments.en: Today's dialogue is all about eating meat and where to go to get meat.
segments.cn: 今天的对话全是关于吃肉和去哪里买肉。

segments.en: So, as Marco said, that place is called The Butcher's.
segments.cn: 正如Marco所说，那地方叫肉店。

segments.en: So we're going to be visiting The Butcher, and we're going to learn all the different types of meat you can find there.
segments.cn: 我们将去肉店，了解那里可以找到的各种肉类。

segments.en: Great, so we don't have anything to preview, but before we get started, I'd just like to mention that you're going to hear a lot of different kinds of words, and we'll be back in a minute to talk about what they mean.
segments.cn: 很好，我们没有什么要预览的，但在开始之前，我想提一下，你会听到很多不同的词，我们会在一分钟后回来讨论它们的意思。

segments.en: Hi, what can I get for you?
segments.cn: 你好，我能为你做些什么？

segments.en: I'd like half a pound of ground beef, please.
segments.cn: 我想要半磅的牛肉末。

segments.en: Good choice.
segments.cn: 好选择。

segments.en: Our ground beef is extra lean, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 我们的牛肉末是特瘦的，你懂的。

segments.en: Could I also have half a dozen pork chops and two pounds of boneless chicken breast?
segments.cn: 我还可以要半打猪排和两磅去骨鸡胸肉吗？

segments.en: No, no, no chicken breasts at the moment, but we have some nice chicken thighs.
segments.cn: 不，不，现在没有鸡胸肉，但我们有一些不错的鸡腿。

segments.en: No, that won't do.
segments.cn: 不，这不行。

segments.en: I'll take this smoked ham you have here.
segments.cn: 我就要你这里的烟熏火腿。

segments.en: Okay, is there anything else?
segments.cn: 好的，还有其他需要吗？

segments.en: Is this salami and Bologna you have here?
segments.cn: 你这里的意大利香肠和博洛尼亚香肠吗？

segments.en: Yes, it's very fine meat.
segments.cn: 是的，肉质非常好。

segments.en: Made it myself.
segments.cn: 我自己做的。

segments.en: Sounds good.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: Okay, that's it.
segments.cn: 好的，就这些。

segments.en: Wait, we have t-bone, ribeye, and sirloin sticks.
segments.cn: 等等，我们有T骨、肋眼和西冷牛排。

segments.en: They are very fresh.
segments.cn: 它们非常新鲜。

segments.en: Just came from the slaughterhouse.
segments.cn: 刚从屠宰场过来。

segments.en: No, that's okay, really.
segments.cn: 不，没关系，真的。

segments.en: I think that's all for today.
segments.cn: 我想今天就这些。

segments.en: Okay, that'll be $34.50.
segments.cn: 好的，总共34.50美元。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So this butcher was kind of creepy in the beginning.
segments.cn: 所以这个肉贩一开始有点可怕。

segments.en: Very creepy in the beginning.
segments.cn: 一开始非常可怕。

segments.en: I think that's usually the conception that you have of butchers because they always have a knife.
segments.cn: 我想这通常是你对肉贩的印象，因为他们总是拿着刀。

segments.en: And they're always covered in blood, but it's not human blood.
segments.cn: 而且他们总是沾满血，但不是人血。

segments.en: Right, like the movie Sweeney Todd.
segments.cn: 对，就像电影《理发师陶德》。

segments.en: Did you see that?
segments.cn: 你看过吗？

segments.en: Yeah, like Sweeney Todd.
segments.cn: 是的，就像《理发师陶德》。

segments.en: The butcher of Fleet Street.
segments.cn: 《弗利特街的肉贩》。

segments.en: But we actually took a look at a lot of different types of meat that the woman was ordering.
segments.cn: 但我们实际上看了很多女人点的不同种类的肉。

segments.en: So why don't we take a look at these now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 那我们现在来看看这些肉在语言收获中。

segments.en: Okay, so the first is a classic cut.
segments.cn: 好的，第一个是经典切割。

segments.en: This is something that we had at my house about once a week growing up.
segments.cn: 这是我小时候每周大约吃一次的东西。

segments.en: It's called a pork chop.
segments.cn: 叫做猪排。

segments.en: Pork chop.
segments.cn: 猪排。

segments.en: So a pork chop comes from the animal, the pork or pig.
segments.cn: 猪排来自猪。

segments.en: Yeah, we actually don't say pork to mean the animal.
segments.cn: 是的，我们实际上不说猪来指代动物。

segments.en: Pork just means the kind of meat that comes from a pig.
segments.cn: 猪肉只是指来自猪的肉。

segments.en: So big difference there when we're talking about food, we say pork.
segments.cn: 所以在谈论食物时，我们说猪肉。

segments.en: Oh, wow.
segments.cn: 哦，哇。

segments.en: And what about a pork chop?
segments.cn: 那猪排呢？

segments.en: So what exactly is that?
segments.cn: 那到底是什么？

segments.en: Chop is usually just on the bone.
segments.cn: 排骨通常是带骨的。

segments.en: And oftentimes it's fried.
segments.cn: 而且通常是炸的。

segments.en: Or baked, I guess.
segments.cn: 或者烤的，我想。

segments.en: But it's just a piece of pork on the bone.
segments.cn: 但它只是带骨的猪肉一块。

segments.en: And a chop, you just imagine a knife chopping something.
segments.cn: 而且排骨，你可以想象刀切东西。

segments.en: Alright, so a pork chop.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以猪排。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And after pork chops, we were ordering some ground beef.
segments.cn: 在猪排之后，我们点了一些牛肉末。

segments.en: Alright, so ground beef is another important one.
segments.cn: 好吧，牛肉末是另一个重要的。

segments.en: Ground beef is beef that's been chopped up and pushed through a machine that kind of pushes it out in very, very small bits and pieces.
segments.cn: 牛肉末是被切碎并通过机器压成非常小的块的牛肉。

segments.en: There's no bones.
segments.cn: 没有骨头。

segments.en: So ground comes from the verb to grind.
segments.cn: 所以牛肉末来自动词“磨”。

segments.en: So to grind up meat, to make it very, very small pieces.
segments.cn: 所以磨肉，就是把肉切成非常小的块。

segments.en: Right, so if you want to make a spaghetti bolognese, the kind of beef you use is ground beef, or even hamburgers.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你想做意大利肉酱，使用的牛肉是牛肉末，或者汉堡。

segments.en: Oh, yeah, exactly.
segments.cn: 哦，是的，正是如此。

segments.en: So ground beef, you ground up beef.
segments.cn: 所以牛肉末，你把牛肉磨碎。

segments.en: What other things would you grind?
segments.cn: 你还会磨其他东西吗？

segments.en: Oh, you could grind your teeth.
segments.cn: 哦，你可以磨牙。

segments.en: Some people do that when they're sleeping, they grind their teeth.
segments.cn: 有些人睡觉时会磨牙。

segments.en: You can grind... you have pepper grinders.
segments.cn: 你可以磨...你有胡椒磨。

segments.en: You know, peppers sometimes come in balls, and you have to grind them to make them smaller and broken down.
segments.cn: 你知道，胡椒有时是球状的，你必须磨碎它们使其变小。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: So that's ground beef, and from the verb to grind.
segments.cn: 所以这就是牛肉末，来自动词“磨”。

segments.en: Now we are buying some boneless chicken breasts.
segments.cn: 现在我们要买一些去骨鸡胸肉。

segments.en: Alright, so boneless, as you have guessed, means without bones.
segments.cn: 好吧，去骨，正如你所猜的，意味着没有骨头。

segments.en: And chicken breasts are usually just a really nice, juicy, kind of tender cut of meat from the chicken, from the kind of underside of the chicken, where, obviously, yeah, they have it.
segments.cn: 鸡胸肉通常是来自鸡的非常好、汁多、嫩的肉，来自鸡的底部，显然，是的，他们有。

segments.en: It's not a wing, it's not a leg, it's just a chicken breast.
segments.cn: 这不是翅膀，也不是腿，只是鸡胸肉。

segments.en: Alright, so boneless chicken breast.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以去骨鸡胸肉。

segments.en: Now usually it is boneless, right, when you buy it at the supermarket.
segments.cn: 通常在超市买的时候是去骨的，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, yeah.
segments.cn: 是的，是的。

segments.en: Next up we've got some classic deli counter favorites.
segments.cn: 接下来我们有一些经典的熟食柜台最爱。

segments.en: These are our cold cuts.
segments.cn: 这些是我们的冷切肉。

segments.en: Alright, so cold cuts.
segments.cn: 好吧，冷切肉。

segments.en: Now this means that they are cold?
segments.cn: 这意味着它们是冷的吗？

segments.en: Oh, well, yeah, they're cold, but I think cold cuts, the most important thing to remember here is that they're mostly like kinds of salami or cured meats.
segments.cn: 哦，嗯，是的，它们是冷的，但我认为冷切肉，最重要的是要记住的是，它们大多是意大利香肠或腌制肉。

segments.en: So these are salt cured or they're dried meats.
segments.cn: 所以这些是盐腌或干肉。

segments.en: And you usually have them on sandwiches, so like a salami sandwich.
segments.cn: 你通常在三明治上吃，比如意大利香肠三明治。

segments.en: So like cured meat, you mean that meat hasn't been cooked?
segments.cn: 所以像腌制肉，你是说那肉没有被煮熟？

segments.en: Oh, no, it's not been cooked, but it's treated in a way that allows it to last for a very long time.
segments.cn: 哦，不，它没有被煮熟，但它以某种方式处理，使其可以保存很长时间。

segments.en: So they look like long, long tubes of meat.
segments.cn: 所以它们看起来像长长的肉管。

segments.en: Or they look very dry.
segments.cn: 或者看起来非常干。

segments.en: They look very dry, like beef jerky, for example.
segments.cn: 它们看起来非常干，比如牛肉干。

segments.en: Alright, so cured meat.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以腌制肉。

segments.en: Now, for example, we have salami and Bologna.
segments.cn: 例如，我们有意大利香肠和博洛尼亚。

segments.en: Bologna.
segments.cn: 博洛尼亚。

segments.en: Now, it's interesting because Bologna is actually spelled B-O-L-O-G-N-A.
segments.cn: 有趣的是，博洛尼亚的拼写是B-O-L-O-G-N-A。

segments.en: So you would say Bologna, Bologna, or something like that.
segments.cn: 所以你会说博洛尼亚，博洛尼亚，或者类似的东西。

segments.en: Well, I think it comes from the Italian Bologna.
segments.cn: 嗯，我认为它来自意大利的博洛尼亚。

segments.en: But it's definitely a change that happened in the English language when it came over from Italy.
segments.cn: 但这绝对是英语在从意大利过来的时候发生的变化。

segments.en: But Bologna is a kind of meat that's got a very funny looking name.
segments.cn: 但博洛尼亚是一种肉，名字看起来很有趣。

segments.en: Yeah, see, you're more sophisticated than I am.
segments.cn: 是的，看到吗，你比我更复杂。

segments.en: That's why you know the difference.
segments.cn: 所以你知道区别。

segments.en: I just speak Italian.
segments.cn: 我只是会说意大利语。

segments.en: Alright, so you have salami, Bologna, and pastrami.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你有萨拉米，博洛尼亚和帕斯特拉米。

segments.en: What about ham?
segments.cn: 火腿呢？

segments.en: Is that considered a cold cut?
segments.cn: 那算不算冷切？

segments.en: You can have ham in the cold cut section because ham sometimes comes in tubes that you slice.
segments.cn: 你可以在冷切区找到火腿，因为火腿有时是装在你切的管子里。

segments.en: But ham is also just a normal kind of pork.
segments.cn: 但火腿也是一种普通的猪肉。

segments.en: But ham is cured, you know.
segments.cn: 但火腿是腌制的，你知道。

segments.en: Like smoked ham.
segments.cn: 就像烟熏火腿。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是。

segments.en: Or smoked Turkey, one of my favorites.
segments.cn: 或者烟熏火鸡，我最喜欢的之一。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: And now moving on from the cold cuts, we're going to concentrate on steaks.
segments.cn: 现在从冷切转到牛排，我们要集中讨论牛排。

segments.en: Ooh, steaks.
segments.cn: 哦，牛排。

segments.en: So there are a thousand kinds of steaks in this world and every city seems to have its own kind.
segments.cn: 这个世界上有成千上万种牛排，每个城市似乎都有自己的一种。

segments.en: But here we're only looking at three, the first of which is the T-bone.
segments.cn: 但在这里我们只看三种，第一种是T骨牛排。

segments.en: Alright, the T-bone steak I think is one of the most popular ones.
segments.cn: 好吧，T骨牛排我认为是最受欢迎的之一。

segments.en: It's a steak that's pretty big, right?
segments.cn: 这是一块相当大的牛排，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, well, yeah, it can be.
segments.cn: 是的，嗯，是的，可能是。

segments.en: And it has a bone inside that looks like a T.
segments.cn: 它里面有一根看起来像T的骨头。

segments.en: Alright, so you're saying, Marco, that the T-bone is named after the shape and the look of this steak.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你在说，马尔科，T骨牛排是根据这块牛排的形状和外观命名的。

segments.en: Yeah, T-bone steak.
segments.cn: 是的，T骨牛排。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: And as well as our next one is also a rib eye.
segments.cn: 还有我们的下一个是肋眼牛排。

segments.en: Okay, so the rib eye I think actually has a piece of the rib in it.
segments.cn: 好吧，我认为肋眼实际上有一块肋骨在里面。

segments.en: So the rib is the bone and there's a circle, which is kind of a... The piece of meat is sliced off the rib and the circle is actually part of that rib.
segments.cn: 所以肋骨是骨头，有一个圆圈，肉块是从肋骨上切下来的，圆圈实际上是那根肋骨的一部分。

segments.en: So there's a little bit of bone in it.
segments.cn: 所以里面有一点骨头。

segments.en: But it's not as bony as the T-bone.
segments.cn: 但它没有T骨那么多骨头。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So it does have one small bone that kind of looks like an eye because you can see through it.
segments.cn: 所以它确实有一小块骨头，看起来像眼睛，因为你可以透过它。

segments.en: And our next steak has no bone and is the most tender and the best steak you can have, sirloin steak.
segments.cn: 而我们的下一个牛排没有骨头，是最嫩的，也是你能吃到的最好的牛排，西冷牛排。

segments.en: So I think the sirloin is definitely the most expensive if you're in a restaurant.
segments.cn: 所以我认为西冷牛排绝对是最贵的，如果你在餐厅里。

segments.en: Definitely the most tender, I think, of all those kinds.
segments.cn: 绝对是所有种类中最嫩的，我认为。

segments.en: And usually you can have like a big sirloin steak, like a half a kilo, like a 400 gram sirloin steak.
segments.cn: 通常你可以吃一块大西冷牛排，比如半公斤，像400克的西冷牛排。

segments.en: I had a friend who ate a full kilo sirloin steak.
segments.cn: 我有一个朋友吃了一公斤的西冷牛排。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: Is it a competition or...?
segments.cn: 是比赛还是...?

segments.en: No, there's a kind of steak called Bisteca a la Fiorentina in Italy.
segments.cn: 不，这是一种叫做佛罗伦萨牛排的牛排，在意大利。

segments.en: It's the Florentine beef steak.
segments.cn: 它是佛罗伦萨的牛排。

segments.en: And it can be about a kilo of meat.
segments.cn: 它可以有大约一公斤的肉。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: I bet you can't even move after that.
segments.cn: 我敢打赌你吃完后连动都动不了。

segments.en: No, you fall asleep with your head in your soup on the table.
segments.cn: 不，你会在桌子上的汤里睡着。

segments.en: Alright, so that's all the meat-related words that we have for you today.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们今天为你准备的所有与肉相关的词汇。

segments.en: So why don't we move on now to Fluency Builder where we're going to take a look at some of the phrases in this dialogue.
segments.cn: 所以我们为什么不现在转到流利度构建器，我们将看看这个对话中的一些短语。

segments.en: We're going to look at the phrases if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 我们将看看“如果你知道我的意思”的短语。

segments.en: If you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: Now, I love this phrase, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 现在，我喜欢这个短语，如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: I do know what you mean.
segments.cn: 我知道你是什么意思。

segments.en: Well, it's weird.
segments.cn: 嗯，这很奇怪。

segments.en: I like it too.
segments.cn: 我也喜欢。

segments.en: So you can use it for sarcasm.
segments.cn: 所以你可以用它来表示讽刺。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Right?
segments.cn: 对吧？

segments.en: Or you can use it to kind of insinuate something, right?
segments.cn: 或者你可以用它来暗示某些事情，对吧？

segments.en: Exactly, yeah.
segments.cn: 正是，是的。

segments.en: So here's what you're saying.
segments.cn: 所以你在说什么。

segments.en: You're saying there's a double meaning in what I want to say.
segments.cn: 你在说我想说的有双重含义。

segments.en: So there's two things I could say and I'm not going to say it outright, but, you know, this thing that we can't really say.
segments.cn: 所以我可以说两件事，我不会直接说出来，但，你知道，这件我们不能真的说的事情。

segments.en: So for example, we can say... She likes to go out, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 所以例如，我们可以说... 她喜欢出去，如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: Alright, so you're insinuating that not only does she like to go out, but maybe... Maybe she goes out a lot.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你在暗示她不仅喜欢出去，也许...也许她出去很多。

segments.en: A lot, or maybe she gets drunk or something like that.
segments.cn: 很多，或者也许她喝醉了，或者类似的事情。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: So it's kind of like a double meaning, but you're trying to be subtle?
segments.cn: 所以这有点像双重含义，但你试图保持微妙？

segments.en: Yeah, but it's not so subtle because you're actually saying like, this is not what I mean.
segments.cn: 是的，但这并不那么微妙，因为你实际上是在说，这不是我所指的。

segments.en: Or she's eating for two, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 或者她在为两个人吃东西，如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: Oh, there we go.
segments.cn: 哦，来了。

segments.en: So you're insinuating that...
segments.cn: 所以你在暗示...

segments.en: Well, you're not really insinuating, you're telling me that.
segments.cn: 嗯，你并不是在暗示，你是在告诉我。

segments.en: She's pregnant!
segments.cn: 她怀孕了！

segments.en: Eating for two is a common idiom in English that means that a person, a woman, has a, well, is going to have a baby.
segments.cn: “为两个人吃东西”是英语中一个常见的成语，意思是一个人，女人，将要有一个宝宝。

segments.en: So here I'm saying, hey, do you know this idiom?
segments.cn: 所以在这里我在说，嘿，你知道这个成语吗？

segments.en: She's eating for two, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 她在为两个人吃东西，如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: Wink, wink, wink.
segments.cn: 眨眼，眨眼，眨眼。

segments.en: Wink, wink.
segments.cn: 眨眼，眨眼。

segments.en: So now why don't we take a look at some other examples of how we could use if you know what I mean in different circumstances when you're trying to insinuate something.
segments.cn: 所以现在我们为什么不看看一些其他例子，看看我们如何在不同情况下使用“如果你知道我的意思”来暗示某些事情。

segments.en: Example one.
segments.cn: 示例一。

segments.en: She's eating for two now, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 她现在在为两个人吃东西，如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: Example two.
segments.cn: 示例二。

segments.en: Tim hit a home run today, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 蒂姆今天打了个全垒打，如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: Example three.
segments.cn: 示例三。

segments.en: Jim and Laura are going their separate ways, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 吉姆和劳拉各走各的路，如果你知道我的意思。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now that that's clear, why don't we move on to our next phrase.
segments.cn: 所以现在这很清楚，我们为什么不转到下一个短语。

segments.en: So this one is a counting phrase.
segments.cn: 所以这个是一个计数短语。

segments.en: And for those of you who have heard the word dozen before, it might not be so new.
segments.cn: 对于那些听过“打”这个词的人来说，这可能并不新鲜。

segments.en: The phrase is half a dozen.
segments.cn: 这个短语是“半打”。

segments.en: Half a dozen.
segments.cn: 半打。

segments.en: So that means half of twelve.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着十二的一半。

segments.en: Twelve.
segments.cn: 十二。

segments.en: So a dozen is twelve.
segments.cn: 所以一打是十二。

segments.en: And it's, I'm not really sure when this started being used in English, but a dozen is twelve and half a dozen is then six.
segments.cn: 我不太确定这个短语是什么时候开始在英语中使用的，但一打是十二，半打就是六。

segments.en: Now there's another phrase or another saying that's very common.
segments.cn: 现在还有另一个短语或说法是非常常见的。

segments.en: A dime a dozen.
segments.cn: 一毛一打。

segments.en: He's a dime a dozen.
segments.cn: 他是一毛一打。

segments.en: So that means you can get twelve of the same type of guys for ten cents.
segments.cn: 这意味着你可以用十美分买到同类型的十二个家伙。

segments.en: Right, so they're easy to find.
segments.cn: 对，所以他们很容易找到。

segments.en: They're easy to find.
segments.cn: 他们很容易找到。

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: The dime a dozen.
segments.cn: 一毛一打。

segments.en: Alright, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And moving on to our last one.
segments.cn: 继续我们的最后一个。

segments.en: When they were talking, they said something about the meat being lean, extra lean.
segments.cn: 当他们在谈论时，他们提到肉是瘦肉，额外瘦。

segments.en: Okay, lean, this does not mean lean on a door.
segments.cn: 好吧，瘦，这并不是说靠在门上。

segments.en: This is not like resting on something.
segments.cn: 这不是像靠在某物上。

segments.en: This is actually a kind of way to describe food.
segments.cn: 这实际上是一种描述食物的方式。

segments.en: And so food is lean if it's not got much fat.
segments.cn: 所以食物是瘦的，如果它没有很多脂肪。

segments.en: It's not fatty.
segments.cn: 它不是油腻的。

segments.en: Okay, so if it's lean, it doesn't have much fat.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以如果它是瘦的，它没有很多脂肪。

segments.en: Exactly, so I prefer to eat lean meats, so I often eat birds and poultry.
segments.cn: 正是如此，所以我更喜欢吃瘦肉，所以我经常吃鸟类和家禽。

segments.en: So chicken, I like it pretty lean.
segments.cn: 所以鸡肉，我喜欢它相当瘦。

segments.en: And if it's got fat on it, I'll cut the fat off.
segments.cn: 如果上面有脂肪，我会把脂肪切掉。

segments.en: Okay, like the skin.
segments.cn: 好吧，比如皮。

segments.en: The skin is fat, right?
segments.cn: 皮是脂肪，对吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Alright, so you can have lean beef.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以你可以有瘦牛肉。

segments.en: It doesn't have much fat around it.
segments.cn: 它周围没有很多脂肪。

segments.en: Yeah, in America, actually, on the packages at the supermarket, it often says the percentage of meat that you have.
segments.cn: 是的，在美国，实际上，在超市的包装上，通常会标明你所拥有的肉的百分比。

segments.en: So it's 95% lean or 98% lean.
segments.cn: 所以是95%瘦或98%瘦。

segments.en: So that means you have 3% fat in there.
segments.cn: 这意味着里面有3%的脂肪。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: Or two.
segments.cn: 或者两。

segments.en: My math skills are amazing.
segments.cn: 我的数学技能真棒。

segments.en: Alright, so now that we've finished with all of these words on Fluency Builder, let's take a look at our dialogue for the last time.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们已经完成了所有这些流利构建器上的单词，让我们最后一次看看我们的对话。

segments.en: Hi, what can I get for you?
segments.cn: 嗨，我能为你做些什么？

segments.en: I'd like half a pound of ground beef, please.
segments.cn: 我想要半磅的绞牛肉，谢谢。

segments.en: Good choice.
segments.cn: 好选择。

segments.en: Our ground beef is extra lean, if you know what I mean.
segments.cn: 我们的绞牛肉是额外瘦的，如果你知道我是什么意思。

segments.en: Could I also have half a dozen pork chops and two pounds of boneless chicken breast?
segments.cn: 我还可以要半打猪排和两磅无骨鸡胸肉吗？

segments.en: No, no, no chicken breasts at the moment.
segments.cn: 不，不，现在没有鸡胸肉。

segments.en: But we have some nice chicken.
segments.cn: 但我们有一些不错的鸡肉。

segments.en: Thighs.
segments.cn: 大腿肉。

segments.en: No, that won't do.
segments.cn: 不，这不行。

segments.en: I'll take this smoked ham you have here.
segments.cn: 我会拿你这里的烟熏火腿。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Is there anything else?
segments.cn: 还有其他的吗？

segments.en: Is this salami and Bologna you have here?
segments.cn: 你这里有意大利腊肠和博洛尼亚吗？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 有的。

segments.en: It's very fine meat.
segments.cn: 这是非常好的肉。

segments.en: Made it myself.
segments.cn: 我自己做的。

segments.en: Sounds good.
segments.cn: 听起来不错。

segments.en: Okay, that's it.
segments.cn: 好吧，就这些。

segments.en: Wait.
segments.cn: 等等。

segments.en: We have t-bone, ribeye, and sirloin sticks.
segments.cn: 我们有T骨、肋眼和西冷牛排。

segments.en: They are very fresh.
segments.cn: 它们非常新鲜。

segments.en: Just came from the slaughterhouse.
segments.cn: 刚从屠宰场过来。

segments.en: No, that's okay, really.
segments.cn: 不，真的没关系。

segments.en: I think that's all for today.
segments.cn: 我想今天就这些。

segments.en: Okay, that'll be $34.50.
segments.cn: 好的，总共34.50美元。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So, uh, Catherine, are you a big beef or meat eater?
segments.cn: 所以，呃，凯瑟琳，你是个大牛肉或肉食爱好者吗？

segments.en: Definitely am.
segments.cn: 绝对是。

segments.en: It helps that my partner in crime is from Kansas City and they have the best, among the best steaks in our entire country.
segments.cn: 我有个犯罪搭档来自堪萨斯城，他们有我们整个国家最好的牛排之一。

segments.en: In Kansas City.
segments.cn: 在堪萨斯城。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: I actually miss, um, there was back in California, we had the $6 burger from Carl's Jr. It was just basically beef, bacon, cheese.
segments.cn: 我实际上很想念，嗯，加州有卡尔斯·朱尼尔的6美元汉堡。 基本上就是牛肉、培根、奶酪。

segments.en: It was just like this huge burger with full of meat and obviously a lot of calories.
segments.cn: 就像这个巨大的汉堡，里面满是肉，显然还有很多卡路里。

segments.en: Oh, yeah.
segments.cn: 哦，是的。

segments.en: But it was delicious.
segments.cn: 但它很好吃。

segments.en: I'm, uh, in Ecuador, we are very used to having some meat product every day with our food.
segments.cn: 我，呃，在厄瓜多尔，我们每天都习惯吃一些肉制品。

segments.en: Yeah, well, it's the same in the Midwest, actually, from where we're from.
segments.cn: 是的，实际上在我们来自的中西部也是一样。

segments.en: It's the same in the Midwest because people in the Midwest generally think that if you're not eating meat, then, you know, what are you eating?
segments.cn: 在中西部也是一样，因为中西部的人通常认为如果你不吃肉，那你在吃什么呢？

segments.en: Bread?
segments.cn: 面包？

segments.en: So, uh, meat is considered a healthy part of the day and you definitely eat it with your meals.
segments.cn: 所以，呃，肉被认为是一天中健康的一部分，你绝对会在餐中吃它。

segments.en: Yeah, and I'm sure our vegetarian listeners might not appreciate this, but, you know, it's just kind of different diets.
segments.cn: 是的，我相信我们的素食听众可能不太喜欢这个，但，你知道，这只是不同的饮食。

segments.en: Some people eat, for example, rice every day.
segments.cn: 有些人每天吃米饭。

segments.en: So, where in other countries you wouldn't really have rice every day.
segments.cn: 所以，在其他国家你不会每天吃米饭。

segments.en: Or, for example, when I was in Chile, I had a lot of potatoes.
segments.cn: 或者，例如，当我在智利时，我吃了很多土豆。

segments.en: Really?
segments.cn: 真的？

segments.en: A lot of potatoes.
segments.cn: 很多土豆。

segments.en: Have you ever had an Argentine steak?
segments.cn: 你吃过阿根廷牛排吗？

segments.en: I hear they have the best beef in the world.
segments.cn: 我听说他们有世界上最好的牛肉。

segments.en: They are not only delicious, but they are very inexpensive and it's amazing.
segments.cn: 它们不仅美味，而且非常便宜，真是惊人。

segments.en: You can have a, like, a complete, um, steak buffet for, like, I don't know, I can't even remember, but it was just, I sat there for three hours and couldn't move and kept eating.
segments.cn: 你可以吃到像完整的，嗯，牛排自助餐，像，我不知道，我甚至记不起来，但我就是坐在那里三个小时，动不了，继续吃。

segments.en: Yeah, was it, is it true you can eat it with a spoon?
segments.cn: 是的，是真的吗？你可以用勺子吃吗？

segments.en: It's so soft?
segments.cn: 它是如此柔软？

segments.en: Some of the meat is very, very tender and not if it's grilled, you can't really do that, but in other preparations it's almost like that.
segments.cn: 有些肉非常，非常嫩，如果是烤的，你真的不能那样做，但在其他准备中几乎是这样的。

segments.en: Mmm, with a nice butter sauce.
segments.cn: 嗯，配上美味的黄油酱。

segments.en: Mmm, herbs.
segments.cn: 嗯，香草。

segments.en: Alright, so, uh... Making me hungry.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以，呃... 让我饿了。

segments.en: I know, you've made me hungry.
segments.cn: 我知道，你让我饿了。

segments.en: I think we're going to take off and have some, uh, a burger or something like that.
segments.cn: 我想我们要走了，去吃个汉堡或类似的东西。

segments.en: Alright, so, uh, if you have any questions, any comments, please come to our website at EnglishPod.com and, uh, we're there to answer any doubts.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以，呃，如果你有任何问题，任何评论，请访问我们的网站EnglishPod.com，呃，我们会回答任何疑问。

segments.en: And we'd love to know what your favorite foods are, meat or otherwise, so post something on our website.
segments.cn: 我们也想知道你最喜欢的食物是什么，无论是肉类还是其他，所以在我们的网站上发布一些内容。

segments.en: Alright.
segments.cn: 好吧。

segments.en: Hope to see you there soon.
segments.cn: 希望很快在那见到你。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: Bye, bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
